alert.note: Alert for Phelps (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 7:36PM CDT until May 10 at 10:25AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Kansas... Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Gasconade River at Jerome affecting Phelps County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Gasconade River Basin...including Jerome, Hazelgreen...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gasconade River at Jerome. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, flood waters affect low lying residential areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Sunday was 21.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.2 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on 03/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
